title: Fuel Injectors and Fuel Rail - Removal

body.body: Fuel Injectors and Fuel Rail - Removal
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Removal seat, battery, fuel tank DB4; DBB; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU4; DUB; DUC

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DUC; DTB; DUB; DTC; DU4; DT4; DB4

body.body: The fuel rail and injectors are removed from the cylinder head together.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the fuel injectors.
Remove the two fixings securing the fuel rail and where fitted, the fuel rail covers to the cylinder head. Collect the spacers between the fuel rail and cylinder head and the two covers.
Fuel rail cover (right hand side shown) (if fitted)
Gently ease the fuel rail and injectors upwards to release them from the cylinder head.
The fuel injectors are not to be removed from the fuel rail unless they are to be replaced.
If the injectors require replacing continue from step 4.
Note the position of the retaining clip for installation.
Carefully remove the retaining clips securing the fuel injectors to the fuel rail.
Ease each injector from the fuel rail.

body.name: Remove Injectors from Fuel Rail abnf_6

search: Fuel Injectors and Fuel Rail - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Perform the following operations:
Seat - Removal
Battery - Removal
Fuel Tank - Removal
The fuel rail and injectors are removed from the cylinder head together.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the fuel injectors.
Remove the two fixings securing the fuel rail and where fitted, the fuel rail covers to the cylinder head. Collect the spacers between the fuel rail and cylinder head and the two covers.
Electrical connector (right hand side shown)
Fuel rail cover (right hand side shown) (if fitted)
Fixing (right hand side shown)
Spacer
Fuel rail
Gently ease the fuel rail and injectors upwards to release them from the cylinder head.
The fuel injectors are not to be removed from the fuel rail unless they are to be replaced.
If the injectors require replacing continue from step 4.
Note the position of the retaining clip for installation.
Carefully remove the retaining clips securing the fuel injectors to the fuel rail.
Ease each injector from the fuel rail.
Retaining clip
Injector
Fuel rail
